snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a study of the best times to post to social media, a report from Foxconn on features of the coming Apple TV and ...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a study of the best times to post to social media, a report from Foxconn on features of the coming Apple TV and a Facebook founder renouncing his U.S. citizenship.

snippet: The Japanese consumer electronics giant expects to return to profit this year, aiming to reduce by half the losses in its television business.
abstract: Sony Corporation posts a record annual loss of 457 billion yen ($5.7 billion) in its fourth straight year of declines as it continues to struggle toward a turnaround.

headline.main: Sony Striving to Cut Its Way From Record Loss to Profit
headline.print_headline: Sony in a 4th Losing Year, The Worst in Its History

snippet: Motherhood, apple pie - and political attacks.     With Mother's Day approaching on Sunday, a ''super PAC'' backing Mitt Romney's presidential campaign has decided to revive the criticism that a Democratic strategist leveled against Mr. Romney's w...
abstract: Caucus column; 'super PAC' backing Mitt Romney's presidential campaign releases ad in advance of Mother's Day that revives the criticism that Democratic strategist Hilary Rosen leveled against Ann Romney and links it to the Obama campaign; ad is part of fierce battle for female voters. Photo (M)

headline.main: Ad Defends Ann Romney, Then Goes on Attack
